name: backfill
content:
backfill verb
(MATERIAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T ] to fill a hole created by digging or drilling, especially using some of the material that has been taken out: Dig a large hole for the plant, then backfill with soil and compost. Finally, backfill the trench.

See more results »
backfill verb
(JOBS)
[ T ] to replace workers after jobs have been made available: Chrysler says it intends to backfill jobs vacated by the buyouts.

material used to fill a hole that has been created by digging, etc.: Some of the fluorite produced from the lead mines was used as backfill underground.
